Reviews.Title: “Hotel Travel”
Reviews.Author: Steven S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location, very cheap prices but wouldnt reccommend hotel to any family or friends. rooms far too small for 4 people

Reviews.Title: “Simple but Sound”
Reviews.Author: ELIZABETH B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: In the very centre of Amsterdam could walk everywhere including train station Very clean hotel. Rooms very simple but had everything required. Staff where friendly and helpful and they have money off vouchers in reception, as well as bar and internet access. will be staying here again if ever back over

Reviews.Title: “Ugh!”
Reviews.Author: OluOlu
Reviews.Content: Okay, note to self; Never let your friends book your hotel for you in Amsterdam! Admittedly, we booked very late and hotels in the centre of Amsterdam are quite expensive. Do they ever have a low season here? The only 2 good things about this hotel is first, it's location; walking distance from Central train station, and secondly you can get lovely hot flavoured teas at 5 am in the morning. Apart from that is a pretty awful hotel and I can only imagine it caters for the 'coffee' shop travellers who are too stoned to care. I was there with 2 friends in early February when the temperature hit a lowly -7degrees C. Needless to say the rooms were cold, the floor even more so. However, the bed were comfortable and all had very warm duvets. There is no lift and the stairs are very narrow. This place is noisy, your can hear people coming and going 24/7. Check out is at an ungodly 10 am! Essentially it is a hostel with a 2/3 star hotel price. Some of my other friends stayed at the Ibis, almost same price but in a parallel universe where comfort is concerned. Well I learnt the hard way, next time I'll stick to the Ibis in Amsterdam if I am going 'budget'. (This is just my opinion shared with the friends I stayed with)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Dave Y Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect for people who want to have a smoke and walk round the red light district. The staff are freindly and helpful. The rooms are basic and clean, and warm considering it was -6 whilst we were there. Would definately stay here again when I go back to the Dam.

Reviews.Title: “We paid peanuts, and got peanuts back!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan M
Reviews.Content: In short, you get what you pay for, and I think everybody knows this. We all paid about 10 euros a night for a 8 bed dorma, cheap and cheerful.. perhaps not as cheerful as it was cheap but cheap none-the-less. I've given the overall rating as poor 2/5, because it was, however we paid accordingly for that. This hotel to be honest with i'll never forget, primarily as the rooms as the 8 bed dorma we choose was about 8/9 staircases up!! It was ridiculous the stairs were unending, I mean sure the location of the hotel was flipping fantastic, everything just around the corner, however the horizontal location of the place was far from that!! Everybody on arriving to the room was panting and out of breathe, which was quite amusing everytime I opened the door to let somebody into the room. However not so amusing when it was my turn to climb mount Everest to return to my room! Note: DO NOT SLEEP IN even 1 minute past checkout for the staff are Ruthless! They barged into the room, and it was pure chaos, as they ejected us all from our beds & threw us out of the room with no warning! GET OUT! So quite literally you do get exactly get what you pay for, precisely by the minute!! ANOTHER thing: While staying there,i noticed a few families staying there too, with small children. Now, my thoughts are simply that I dont think this is a family hotel, or anywhere for children. 1 incident, on the way to our skyhigh room, we noticed some very dodgy behaviour taking place in one of the room near us, involving 6 mexican looking individuals and a naked blonde lady lying on a bed. On spotting us, the door was slammed closed! As for what was taking place in that room ?!Â£?! be my guest.. however like i said, not for children, plus the area is around the corner from the Red Light District I think this is mutually appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “I NEED HELP!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nicola G
Reviews.Content: Hi :) me and a group of 7 friends are staying in this hotel in February. the amount left which is oayable to the hotel is 200 euros, do i give them cash up front or can i pay by card? x

Reviews.Title: “Good convenient location, but otherwise average hostel”
Reviews.Author: IzzyKL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before our flight back home. We booked a few beds in the 10-bed dorm. It was a rather average, standard hostel dorm. The man at the reception area was quite nice. We'd arrived very early in the morning by overnight coach from London, and since it wasn't check-in time yet, the man let us store our bags and freshen up in the public restroom first. The place is very convenient to walk around Amsterdam, but then again it isn't that big an area anyway. Bikes are easily available for rent everywhere too. The Red Light District is right behind the hostel, as is a coffeeshop located next to it. Quite a fair amount of bakeries around too but expect touristy prices. The toilets and showers were relatively clean, there were 2 of each in our dorm. I'd say you get what you pay for, it's relatively clean and we didn't really expect too much from a hostel for 20EUR a night in Summer. Big plus point is that it's within walking distance to the Central Station, and the Anne Frank house, if you're interested.

Reviews.Title: “Poor, cheap hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Matthew S
Reviews.Content: The place is about a 5-10 minute walk from Central Station and right next to the red light district. My family with two small kids stayed in the quad room with 4 single beds and a private bathroom. It was pretty dingy, but my kids loved it, especially playing in the lockers. The staff was good and the people in the hotel were pretty respectful, but the walls were very thin and you could here everything in the halls and stairwell. Our room was on the 3rd floor, right next to the stairwell. The kids slept great but I am a light sleeper and did not sleep very well. We booked it as a last resort and was hoping to find something else and cancel this place. I would not stay there again. If you are a group of young people looking to party, it would be great. Not really family friendly. It has a 24-hour bar and a pool table downstairs, so if you are a light sleeper get drunk and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “our trip to dam!”
Reviews.Author: Lynn99990
Reviews.Content: i have been to amsterdam before, so ive stayed in other hostels. When me and 2 of my friends booked this hotel we were concerned after reading reviews, however when we got to the hotel, we asked the receptionist if we could see the room before we paid, but she told us they do not show rooms and asked us why we had concerns, we told her about the reviews of mice etc... She was actually really nice and told us what we already knew, its an old building and if you leave food lying around your room there is a possability you might see a mouse. She told us if we did see anything we didnt like she would change our room which set our minds at ease. The room was basic and clean as was our bathroom. The 5 flights of starirs to get there was a bit of a climb but definatly quite a quirky experiance, probably did us all some good as it was the only excersise we were getting for a few days. On our last day we overslept and checked out an hour late. The staff were very nice about it. After trailing our luggage down the 5 flights, we realised we had one of the housekeepers following us with a ring i had left behind and some cash my friend had left in his pillowcase.(he had run down 5 flights to catch us) I think this hotel gets a hard time on reviews.. Its no palace but it never said it was. You get what you pay for! If your looking for the ritz! get your wallet out and go somewhere else. Perfect for budget travelling! and we never saw any mice at all!

Reviews.Title: “dump.”
Reviews.Author: shaunC1983
Reviews.Content: this hotel was rubbish the only good things are the location and it has a 24 hour bar...i wasnt drinking though but my friends made good use of it also has a pool table...staff were friendly enough and my friends managed to get tickets for free entry into a night club at rembrandt square from one of them..we were in a 4 bed room which was worse than a jail cell must have been on the fourth floor we had a great view of a brick wall about 6 inches from the window so dont expect any natural light in there also looking down between the buildings it was just litter so if you smoke dont throw your cigarettes/joints out the window because you will probably burn the building down. the locks are hanging off some of the doors ours was fine also im sure its a hostel too and there seemed to be someone living there who seemed to be absolutely out his face lying about all over the hotel the whole time i wouldnt take kids there. it wasnt even that cheap either considering how much of a dump the place is...there are no carpets in the room and the shared shower was missing the shower head so was like washing down with a hose. there are lockers there but i think your stuff is safer in the room with the door left open. also charge you deposit for the key cards for the room which decide to stop working from time to time..i would never stay here again i wouldnt even walk past it again. and if you are a light sleeper get ear plugs because the church bells will drive you insane. there is internet cafe and coffeeshop right outside and just around the corner from everything else we needed could have never went further than 5 mins from the hotel and had a great time coming back to the hotel was the dissappointing part.

Reviews.Title: “Close but no Cigar!”
Reviews.Author: MarkGregson1988
Reviews.Content: Having just booked another trip to the Dam, I forgot to leave a review for this 'Hotel' (If you can call it that!) me and my friends stayed in last time. If you want convenience and location, you can't get much closer to the heart of the city than here. However, if you want to enjoy your stay and have a wonderful time, choose another hotel! Upon arrival I was told that there wasn't any record of our booking, but the confirmation sheets in my hand told me otherwise! After half an hour of waiting around for the incompetent woman at reception to sort herself out, we were ushered into a room which was at best, dreadful! It wasn't big enough for 1 bed let alone 4! The only plus side coming from the mould and grime ridden room was the the en-suite, which was no haven but acceptable. Then the 'best' part of our stay here happened very early on the first morning when i was awoken by a rustling in my bag on the floor. When I investigated, out popped a mouse which ran to the other end of the room and out underneath the door! Great, so now 4 guys and a rodent are sharing this room! With not wanting to speak to the receptionist again, we decided to see if the mouse would return the next night. Low and behold it had and ate food on top of a draw next to my friends head! Much deliberation then pursued on how the mouse actually got up there, and with one route which was along my friends bed been the only obvious one, he wasn't best pleased! The moral of this story folks, look a bit harder and find somewhere else! I can imagine ANYWHERE else would be better!

Reviews.Title: “WORST PLACE I EVER STAYED IN!!”
Reviews.Author: vegasbabex
Reviews.Content: Dark, dingy and mouldy dump ... no lift and got stuck right up on the 5th floor ... only thing in its favour was the lift ... view from window was a graffiti covered wall ... never again!!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: skandwm
Reviews.Content: This hostel is close to the central station which is convenient if you are travelling from the airport. The hostel is located in the centre of Amsterdam and is a short walk from most points of interest. The staff at this hostel and unfriendly and unwilling to help.. even to check in. There is no escalator and we were on the fifth floor. Which wasn't ideal but it was made even worse by the narrow spiral staircase. The room we stayed in was for four and it was cramped with no room to move and there is one toilet and one shower for the floor. There is also no place to store your luggage on the day of departure.

Reviews.Title: “Last resort”
Reviews.Author: rebeccacole1
Reviews.Content: stayed in the travel hotel for three nights in a 6 bed dorm for â‚¬25 a night. I would only stay again is in an ensuite room, as the shower in the corridors are filthy so filthy I couldnt use it and when I did I came out feeling more dirty than when I went in, however the best thing about this hotel are the people who we shared with the room with they were amazing :) and the bells!!!! Omg every 15 mins but they stop during the night so it doesnt interfere with sleep. The staff were ok, the woman that worksthere was unhelpful and weird, as if she used to be addicted to drugs and totally unhelpful, However the man who works in the morning is amazing totally helpful. Even though It wouldn't be my First choice the location is excellent and I would stay again in an ensuite room.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T TRY THIS PLACE !!! STAY FAR AWAY”
Reviews.Author: CapeTownRichard
Reviews.Content: This hotel must rank amongst worst in Amsterdam let alone Europe. It can only appeal to a special type of person who likes - tiny cluttered rooms, rude staff, extremely high rates, dirty rooms, shocking lockers, broken windows, broken curtains, blocked drains that flood room, no stock of toilet paper, noisy drain pipes past your bed, street fights, nasty fellow guests awake to all hours shouting and drinking and permament smell of marijuana in corridors and from street below. We ended up there by default after other Amsterdam hotel cancelled booking 1 day before arrival and they then recommended this place for my family of 4; it was one of the most degrading experiences of my life and most definitely not for families or children.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for stag do's!!!”
Reviews.Author: simonowen007
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from my stag do and we stayed here for 3 nights. They were very helpful and even moved beds in rooms so we could have 14 of us in 2 rooms next to each other. 10 mins walk from the train station and right around the corner from the redlight district...what more could u want?! Most bars shut at 3am but at the hotel u can drink until whatever time u like. â‚¬4 for a beer which is pretty much what we paid everywhere else. Definately use 'the grasshopper' as somewhere to ask for directions too as you'll never find your way back to 'hotel travel' at 3am otherwise! Probably wouldn't go here again though unless it's was with another stag do. The rooms were not the best by any stretch of the immagination but we were hardly ever in them....we spent more time in the bar than we did in the room!! Great place to meet people from all over the world. Americans, Irish and some malteese while we were there!'

Reviews.Title: “Disgustin”
Reviews.Author: MartyNewHaven
Reviews.Content: I stayed in hostels for three weeks on this trip and this was the worst by far: unhelpful staff, dirty rooms, steep and dreary staircase, parties until dawn. Stay here only if you have no other choice.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: damagerb
Reviews.Content: For 10 Euros a night we weren't expecting much but we loved it! The location is fantastic, 10 minute walk from the train station, at least 5 coffee shops within a stones throw(there's one right next door!) and round the corner from the red light district. I went with a friend and my partner, we had booked a shared room so expected to be sleeping with strangers but ended up having a room to ourselves, except the last night which we were joined by a very friendly man who was no bother at all. The room was clean and consisted of 2 bunk beds, 4 lockers, a sink and a TV, with the toilets just across the corridor. There were church bells that seemed to go on all night, but you stopped noticing them after a while. The bar downstairs was small and expensive(seemed to be expensive for beer everywhere!) but we ended up having a good time with the lady who was working there and managed to finish off their beer!! Great hotel for travellers and stoners alike who are just looking for a place to sleep, did i mention there's no curfew...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for stags”
Reviews.Author: ramsaymfc
Reviews.Content: after reading some reviews of this hotel i wasnt looking forward to stay in it. Quite frankly the bad reviews of this hotel are a lot of nonsense. u get wot u pay for, rooms were very clean, beds were comfy, toilets and showers were clean and the shower was always hot. The church bells every1 is moaning about, never even heard them once!!! The location is perfect, right next to train staion and red light district, also the police station is next door ( if u r looking for directions to the hotel just ask for the grasshopper bar, its right next to it.) Would not recommend drinking in the bar however as it is quite expensive although you are littered with bars next to the hotel. There was 22 of us and would definately recomend if going for a stag weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Dont use this hotel”
Reviews.Author: yipgirl
Reviews.Content: I booked a surprise trip here for my partner on his birthday. The hotel looked okay from the pictures, so i thought that if i was paying 90 euros a night it would be descent. I was so wrong. I prebooked weeks in advance and was still given room at the top of building, up many flights of steep stairs. When my partner told the management he suffered with a bad back, and could we change rooms or get some kind of refund for the 2 nights we were told it was not the hotels problem. They were just rude and unhelpful. We managed tosleep there for 1 night without any kind of air con or even a fan. The heat was inbearable, the room tiny and dirty. We found a beautiful hotel the following day for just 129 euros called NH. Was worth losing my money to stay there..... Please ndont book Travel Hotel Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap budget hotel but not terrible”
Reviews.Author: TexasLonghorn4Life
Reviews.Content: At the rate we were able to book this ($10 per bed for a quad room and shared bath), I was expecting the worst but pleasantly surprised. It's close to the train station (10-20 min walk). We were on the 4th floor (no elevators) and had 2 bunk beds in the room and a sink. Not much walking space in the room. Baths were shared but very clean. Staff was nice. Towels and linens were included. Since we had the whole room to ourselves, we did not use the lockers, but we noticed the lockers did not seem very useful as big combination locks nor smaller suitcase locks did not fit on the locks (so backpackers traveling alone, be careful). If you can book the entire room, then you're fine. Overall, at 40 euro a night for 3 nights, that was the cheapest and best place to stay. Try to request a room away from the bathrooms (as the doors slam pretty loudly). We never had a problem and slept soundly. There is a church bell tower that rings till like 11pm and then starts around 6 or 7am again but that didn't bother us.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the reviews”
Reviews.Author: wickywoo
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from a three night stay here with three mates. the room was small but we weren't bothered after all we weren't planning on staying in the room much. the bathroom we had was clean, again spot on for what we needed. the location was brilliant and the staff were all helpful. for the price it was really good. wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this "hotel" at all costs!!!”
Reviews.Author: eschech
Reviews.Content: The Travel Hotel is actually a hostel...and the farthest thing from a hotel that I have ever seen. While the location is pretty great, everything else about this hotel is terrible. It was the cheapest option my friend and I had so we ignored the reviews but after staying we wish we hadn't! This place was DIRTY. The sheets were stained and the bathroom reeked of urine. The bathroom doors would automatically slam shut, so we were awoken multiple times nightly from this. There was also a church nearby that had loud incessant bells ringing every 30 minutes, even overnight, which aided in our inability to sleep. The mattress was OK but the pillows were a clumpy mess of cotton balls. Both my friend and I probably woke up 10 times throughout the night each of the 3 nights of our stay. But the worst has yet to come. In our room, hanging from the ceiling, was a disgusting condom! We didn't discover this until our last night as we never really looked up at the ceiling (the only time we spent in that terrible dungeon of a place was late at night before falling asleep), but there was a condom literally hanging from the ceiling. How it got there, we have no idea. But this place is a terrible disgusting crappy place, and I strongly advise you stay elsewhere at all costs!!

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: AleezaK
Reviews.Content: The hotel was decent. Basic double room and the shower and toilets across the hall.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for backpackers,excellent location for the price!”
Reviews.Author: OceanIreland
Reviews.Content: In December 2008, my friends and I went to Amsterdam to bring in 2009. We were looking for somewhere cheap and cheerful, our expectations of the travel hotel were low from reading the travellers reviews! From Schiphol Airport get the train it was â‚¬2 and took 20-30mins, don't waste you monet on taxis! It is only a 5/8min walk from the station ot the hotel!When we arrived we were greeted by a lady on reception who cleary loved her job; I think we got about 2 smiles off her for our 4 day trip!The stairs was very narrow, however it was only a problem coming home after a night out!The girls and I got a nice dorm with 8 beds, it was clean however we had no handle on the bathroom door,it broke on the first day!In our dorm, every morning at 10am and 12pm church bells would ring right outside our window....very annoying! The boys dorm was very cramped you could not swing a cat in their room, very small! The location was no other than excellent everything is in walking distance, we went in december it was FREEZING weather so my advice is bring warm clothing I'm talking leggings under your jeans it was bitter (-2/3).If you want a bed and shower for a good price in the city centre, go for this place!Really enjoyed Amsterdam and would definitley go back and stay here again,even though it has a few minor faults!

Reviews.Title: “Stay if you really have to.”
Reviews.Author: type47
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Travel hotel in Feb, in order to spend a couple of days exploring the delights of Amsterdam. Booked this hotel despite what I'd read on Tripadvisor, as I was having some trouble finding a hotel. On arrival we were informed, somewhat curtly, that they wouldn't accept payment by card,(despite the fact that it said that they would on their window, and so we had to venture out to get some cash (though they did let us leave the suitcases there.) Once in our room, up several flight of very narrow stairs, we had to clean the bathroom, as it obviously hadn't been cleaned and there was a generous helping of someone else hair scattered liberally thoughout. Thankfully it didn't take too long as the bathroom was the smallest I have ever seen. You had to step over the toilet to get in to the shower. The room was quite grimy, but the television worked Ok once we'd replaced the batteries for the remote, the window opened, and the bed was do-able, even though they'd taken the unusual step of using a single sheet placed sideways over a double bed. The location of the hotel is great for a tourist visit to amsterdam. It's on the main road, very near to the train station and the red light district. Probably best for a long weekend though, and don't book if you have knee problems

Reviews.Title: “I beg u do not go!!!!”
Reviews.Author: missindependant
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we thought it would be better than staying in a hostel...So wrong we stayed on the 5th floor that had no lift the stairs was so narrow we had to lift and twist or cases to get up there. The loo got blocked. And the place was basically a flea pit. I had read teh reviews thinking ...well I am not that fussy but if you stay there you will regret it we went on the stay at other hostels in europe which were much cleaner quieter and user friendly. Some dude kept trying to get into our room when he was too drunk to remember where his own was found him the next morning sleeping in the coridoor. This is basically a poorly run hostel. If people partying in the next room wont keep you awake the church bells that go off every 15 mins will drive you mad not great when you have a hang over

Reviews.Title: “Good for what it is”
Reviews.Author: DPBLondon
Reviews.Content: This is good value if you want a very central place to crash. I stayed in a 12 bed dorm with clean sheets, floors, very clean toilet/shower in room + one outside. There are lockers for your luggage for a deposit. The staff were helpful and friendly, 24hr etc. There's a 24hr bar in the hotel which doesn't seem to be used much. The hotel backs onto Warmoerstrat, a busy street of bars & there are loud church bells in the morning so if you're a light sleeper bring earplugs! But if you're after an incredibly central place to crash with your mates within a short walk of Centraal Station, Red Light District, Dam Square etc you could do far worse.

Reviews.Title: “Faeces smeared radiator!! So bad I checked back out!!”
Reviews.Author: thelesserknown
Reviews.Content: I have to say this is the worst hotel I have ever set foot in! I have stayed in some pretty dodgy places in my time but none were anywhere near as bad as this! On first impression the hotel looked quite dated and run down, but we figured seen as we had booked it 3 months before we would give the place a chance. Our room was number 5009, it was on the fifth floor, up some seriously narrow staircases, the last one didn't even have a hand rail on the majority of it. We then walked through what can only be described as shabby corridors with spare pieces of wood and DIY equipment lying at the sides. When we eventually reached our room it was very small. We had booked an en-suite room which this was (only just) to get into the shower you would have had to climb over the toilet (the bathroom was no more than 1m square! The bathroom was so small the sink didn't fit into it. The sink which was in the bedroom had some brackets above it for a shelf, although there was no shelf on the brackets. The wall light next to the bed had no shade so it was just a bare metal bracket sticking out of the walls with large screws poking out and a bare bulb. The window was blocked by the bed (the window came up from the floor no more than a meter), when sat on the bed it felt as though it was going to fall out of the window into the cobbled street five floors below (the floor was slanting towards the window). What finally topped things off was when I noticed the brown smear of faeces across the radiator, I was nearly sick at this point and decided I couldn't stay. The only redeeming feature this hotel had was the helpful young man on reception who told his boss what had happened and which room number it was, who then instructed him to give us our money back! It seemed as though when the boss heard the room number he decided straight away to give us the money back (maybe this is the worst of their rooms?) Anyway all in all from the parts of the hotel I saw I would say it wasn't fit for my worst enemy! Disgusting!!!! We ended up staying in a hotel up the road called the Terminus.

Reviews.Title: “never again!”
Reviews.Author: emma023
Reviews.Content: went to amsterdam for a weekend, got to the travel hotel (which is located in the red light district) it said on the website that i made the booking on that it was on the damrak, i had payed for the "room" which is actually dormary room (didnt say that on web page) total rip off for prices 95 euro, lady at reception was totally useless! and manager was the same both did not want to help., walked out and got accomation at a proper hotel!

Reviews.Title: “can't fault it for the money”
Reviews.Author: firest0rm
Reviews.Content: Just returned (26/10/07) from a 3 night stay at the Travel Hotel and having read the other reviews before we went, i was a little apprehensive to say the least. I even made a short list of other hotels in the area to try if this one really was that bad. What a pleasant suprise we had, we were offered a choce of 2 rooms, one on the 1st floor and one on the 5th. After looking at both we took the one on the 1st floor (no lift and plenty of narrow stairs to the 5th floor). The lady with the blonde hair who works there in the evening was lovely, very friendly and helpfull, she made us feel welcome. The room (number 1001) was plenty big enough for myself and my wife, we had our own en-suite shower, toilet sink, a bit dated but clean. The room was furnished ok, the two single beds were pushed together and the linen, towels etc where spotless as were the curtains. The heating was on all day and was too hot at times and had to turn the radiator off. The flooring was laminate flooring and again spotlessly clean. Overall, We found it to be a clean, warm, friendly, buget hotel within a couple of minutes walk from Central station and ideally situated within a short stroll of all Amsterdam has to offer, we had a great time, and would deffinately stay at The Travel Hotel. .

Reviews.Title: “For the fit and young!”
Reviews.Author: sheer
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend at The Travel Hotel. I think it would be fair to say that we got value for money as it was only 180 euros for 2 ppl for 3 nights! We stayed in one of the very few rooms with en suite facilities. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The atmosphere in the bar was relaxed but the bed linen left a little to be desired. We did a lot of walking during our stay and the climb to the 5th floor each evening up a steep spiral staircase was a little like mountaineering for beginners!!! You should be aware that the hotel has 2 entrances, one just a few yards from the police station (although there was never any trouble or noise from there) and the other door which leads directly into the red light district. The main source of noise at night was from the local church bells which chime every 15 mins in a rather random and haphzard way....often giving the wrong time and making you feel like maybe you spent too long in the "Coffee House". The whole area around the hotel is a colourful maze of shops/ bars/ restaurants etc and the place has a wonderful carnival feel to it. However, I think this might have been a little wearing if we had been staying for a longer break.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again !!!”
Reviews.Author: kanga007
Reviews.Content: What a dive ! If this hotel has a 1 star rating then i didnt see it . The bugs and smell were an absolute disgrace and i would rather stay in guantanamo bay than reside in the travel hotel ever again .

Reviews.Title: “Bug Bites”
Reviews.Author: 4NDY
Reviews.Content: I was at the Travel Hotel Amsterdam between 27th July to 1st of Aug 2006. My room mate started to see red spots on his skin after only one night. We presumed at 1st that it was an allergic reaction to the sheets or something he had eaten, but probably didn't take it as seriously as we should have. I started to show little red spots on my skin on the day I was leaving, and since then 2 of my friends, who also stopped in the same room, are showing the same spots. My friend who 1st got the bites is covered head to toe in red spots now and his doctor has no idea what the spots are. I am assuming they are bug bites after reading a previous review, but whatever they are, it is NOT good, and they are beginning to spread across my body, which is also NOT good. I suggest that you avoid this hotel if possible, and if you can't, avoid Room 2001. I should also add that there is a mixture of helpful staff and very unhelpful staff working at the hotel, which all in all added up to a frustrating stay. To summarise, don't go there. Andy

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but OK”
Reviews.Author: RouseysTravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 1 night with 4 other members of our group. It is a basic 1* hotel, so i was prepared for it. The rooms are simple and the sheets and bed where clean. Suit lads holiday!!

HotelInfo.Name: Travel Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Beurstraat 23, Amsterdam 1012 JV, The Netherlands
